meanings: (옷을) (동작) put on, dress, get dressed; (걸치다) slip on; (급히) throw on; (상태) wear, have (sth) on, be dressed in
(도움·은혜 등을) be indebted to, get[receive] a favor, be favored (with)

meanings.meaning: trousers worn threadbare by much use

examples.korean: He was badly wounded in the war and still bears the scars. 발음듣기 그는 전쟁에서 심한 부상을 입어서 아직도 그 흉터가 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He was badly wounded in the war and still bears the scars. 발음

examples.korean: He is injured and is doubtful for the game tomorrow. 발음듣기 그는 부상을 입어서 내일 경기가[경기 출전이] 의심스럽다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He is injured and is doubtful for the game tomorrow. 발음

examples.korean: The team suffered a major setback when their best player was injured. 발음듣기 그 팀은 팀 내 최우수 선수가 부상을 입어서 중대한 차질을 겪었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The team suffered a major setback when their best player was injured. 발음

examples.korean: The team has made some positional changes because two players are injured. 발음듣기 두 명의 선수가 부상을 입어서 그 팀이 (선수들의) 위치에 변화를 좀 주었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The team has made some positional changes because two players are injured. 발음

examples.korean: That colour doesn’t flatter many people. 발음듣기 그 색깔이 많은 사람들을 돋보이게 하는 건 아니다[그 색깔을 입어서 돋보이는 사람이 많은 것은 아니다]. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: That colour doesn’t flatter many people. 발음
